histogram.name: IOS.CommittedNavigationHasContext
histogram.summary: When a navigation is committed, it should have a non-null NavigationContext. This histogram counts the frequency of this invariant holding at the time when a new navigation is committed. It is used to verify the effectiveness of code fixes because this issue is not currently reproducible in testing (http://crbug.com/864769). True means a non-null NavigationContext is present.

histogram.name: IOS.CommittedURLMatchesCurrentItem
histogram.summary: When a navigation is committed, the web view URL is expected to match that of the current back-forward item. WKWebView seems to break this assumption at times. This histogram counts the frequency of this invariant violation at the time when a new navigation is committed. True means the URL matches the current back-forward item.

histogram.name: IOS.ContentExtension.DisplayCount
histogram.summary: The number of times the Content Extension was displayed since last Chrome foregrounding. Reported when Chrome is put in foregrounded.

histogram.name: IOS.ContentExtension.Index
histogram.summary: The index of the URL selected by the user in the Content Extension.

histogram.name: IOS.ContentRuleListProviderUpdateSuccess
histogram.summary: When the content rule list provider updates its lists, this can succeed or fail. Failure occurs when the rule lists are updated again before the first update finishes.

histogram.name: IOS.Cookies.GetCookiesForURLCallResult
histogram.summary: Recorded to indicate whether the GetCookiesForURL call found cookies or not when called on a specific system cookie store implementation. Most of the cookies fetching on iOS Chromium is done by the WKWebView and doesn't involve calling GetCookiesForURL. The method is only called when a request is made by the UrlRequestFetcher for cases that are not handled by WKWebView (eg. Downloads, Auto Suggestions and NTP tiles).

histogram.name: IOS.Cookies.GetCookiesForURLCallStoreType
histogram.summary: The system cookie store type used when GetCookiesForURL method is called. Most of the cookies fetching on iOS Chromium is done by the WKWebView and doesn't involve calling GetCookiesForURL. The method is only called when a request is made by the UrlRequestFetcher for cases that are not handled by WKWebView (eg. Downloads, Auto Suggestions and NTP tiles).

histogram.name: IOS.CredentialExtension.CopyPasswordCount
histogram.summary: The number of times the Credential Extension user copied a Password since last Chrome foregrounding. Reported when Chrome is put in foreground.

histogram.name: IOS.CredentialExtension.CopyURLCount
histogram.summary: The number of times the Credential Extension user copied a URL since last Chrome foregrounding. Reported when Chrome is put in foreground.

histogram.name: IOS.CredentialExtension.CopyUsernameCount
histogram.summary: The number of times the Credential Extension user copied a Username since last Chrome foregrounding. Reported when Chrome is put in foreground.

histogram.name: IOS.CredentialExtension.DisplayCount
histogram.summary: The number of times the Credential Extension was displayed since last Chrome foregrounding. Reported when Chrome is put in foreground.

histogram.name: IOS.CredentialExtension.FetchPasswordFailure
histogram.summary: The number of times the Credential Extension password util failed to look up for a password since last Chrome foregrounding. Reported when Chrome is put in foreground.

histogram.name: IOS.CredentialExtension.FetchPasswordNilArgument
histogram.summary: The number of times the Credential Extension pasword util was queried with a nil argument since last Chrome foregrounding. Reported when Chrome is put in foreground.

histogram.name: IOS.CredentialExtension.PasswordUseCount
histogram.summary: The number of times the Credential Extension user selected for a Password since last Chrome foregrounding. Reported when Chrome is put in foreground.

histogram.name: IOS.CredentialExtension.QuickPasswordUseCount
histogram.summary: The number of times the Credential Extension selected a Password without user intervention since last Chrome foregrounding. Reported when Chrome is put in foreground.

histogram.name: IOS.CredentialExtension.ReauthCount
histogram.summary: The number of times the Credential Extension needed user reauthentication since last Chrome foregrounding. Reported when Chrome is put in foreground.

histogram.name: IOS.CredentialExtension.SearchCount
histogram.summary: The number of times the Credential Extension user searched for a Password since last Chrome foregrounding. Reported when Chrome is put in foreground.

histogram.name: IOS.CredentialExtension.Service.Error.ReplaceCredentialIdentitiesWithIdentities
histogram.summary: Recorded when a request to replace identities in ASCredentialIdentityStore fails.

histogram.name: IOS.CredentialExtension.ShowPasswordCount
histogram.summary: The number of times the Credential Extension user unobfuscated a Password since last Chrome foregrounding. Reported when Chrome is put in foreground.

histogram.name: IOS.CriticalActionBackgroundTimeRemaining
histogram.summary: Recorded when app is running in the background and posted a background task. This time is obtained by calling UIApplication.backgroundTimeRemaining. When backgroundTimeRemaining reaches 0 and there is at least one running background task, then iOS terminates the app instead of suspending it. The lower recorded value is, the higher chances that posted task will keep running when backgroundTimeRemaining reaches 0, causing the app termination. When app is relaunched after termination the app starts cold which is slower and does not fully restore the prior UI state, so terminations are worse than suspensions.

histogram.name: IOS.CRWWKNavigationStatesRemoveOldPending
histogram.summary: Workaround for a WKWebView bug where WKNavigations can leak, leaving a permanent pending URL, thus breaking the omnibox. While it is possible for navigations to finish out-of-order, it's an edge case that should be handled gracefully, as last committed will appear in the omnibox instead of the pending URL. This metric records whether there are old navigations to clean up each time a navigation finishes. See crbug.com/1010765 for details.

histogram.name: IOS.DefaultBrowserFullscreenPromo
histogram.summary: The action taken by the user in response to the default browser promo.

histogram.name: IOS.Dialogs.JavaScriptDialogClosed
histogram.summary: Tracks the way JavaScript dialogs are closed on iOS.

histogram.name: IOS.DragAndDrop.DragContent
histogram.summary: The type of content that the user is dragging into Chrome. Because a drag can contain multiple types of objects, multiple DragContent values may be recorded for a single drag event.

histogram.name: IOS.EnterTabSwitcherSnapshotResult
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of snapshotting when the user enters the tab switcher. Recorded whenever the user enters the tab switcher.

histogram.name: IOS.FinishedNavigationHasContext
histogram.summary: When a navigation is finished, it should have a non-null NavigationContext. This histogram counts the frequency of this invariant holding at the time when a new navigation is finished. It is used to verify the effectiveness of code fixes because this issue is not currently reproducible in testing (http://crbug.com/864769). True means a non-null NavigationContext is present.

histogram.name: IOS.FinishedNavigationHasItem
histogram.summary: When a navigation is finished, it should have a non-null NavigationItem. This histogram counts the frequency of this invariant holding at the time when a new navigation is finished. It is used to verify the effectiveness of code fixes because this issue is not currently reproducible in testing (http://crbug.com/864769). True means a non-null NavigationItem is present.

histogram.name: IOS.FinishedURLMatchesCurrentItem
histogram.summary: When a navigation is finished, the web view URL is expected to match that of the current back-forward item. WKWebView seems to break this assumption at times. This histogram counts the frequency of this invariant violation at the time when a new navigation is finished. True means the URL matches the current back-forward item.

histogram.name: IOS.FormInputAccessory.ExecuteFormAssistActionException
histogram.summary: Reports exceptions when trying to send a form input accessory action to the virtual keyboard.

histogram.name: IOS.Handoff.Origin
histogram.summary: This event is recorded each time a Handoff is received by Chrome on iOS. The enumeration indicates the source of the Handoff.

histogram.name: IOS.Incognito.TimeSpent
histogram.summary: The time incognito profile is displayed to the user. Incognito sessions during less than 10 seconds are not reported. Incognito session paused for less than 10 seconds is resumed.

histogram.name: IOS.IPHBubbleDismissalReason
histogram.summary: Tracks the reason for why the In Product Help bubble was dismissed.

histogram.name: IOS.IsDefaultBrowser
histogram.summary: As of iOS14, users will be able to set a default browser other than Safari. When Chrome is the default browser, it will receive all URL opens, which is likely to change certain stability metrics. Thus, it will be good to filter those metrics by default browser status. This metrics records whether the user was deemed to have set Chrome as the device's default browser. This metric will be logged once per metrics log upload.

histogram.name: IOS.IsEligibleDefaultBrowserPromoUser
histogram.summary: This metric reports whether the user was deemed eligible to be shown default browser fullscreen promos. Eligibility currently includes signed-in users, external intent app opens, clipboard copies, and GrowthKit opens. This metric will be logged once per metrics log upload.

histogram.name: IOS.JavascriptContentBlockFailure
histogram.summary: IOS Content Blocking uses special injected Javascript to block access to things like cookies and local storage. Future changes to iOS/WebKit could cause these blocks to break. This logs that occurrence.

histogram.name: IOS.LocationPermissions.FirstRunModal.Interaction
histogram.summary: The user engagement of the Location permissions first run modal.

histogram.name: IOS.LocationPermissionsUI
histogram.summary: The user was shown an arm of the location permissions experiment. Recorded when the user is shown the UI of an experiment arm. Not recorded for the control arm.

histogram.name: IOS.MainThreadFreezeDetection.RecoveredAfter
histogram.summary: The time during which main thread was not responding. 0 if application was killed before recovering. Logged after an action posted on the main thread is not executed immediately. The histogram is sent when the task is finally executed or on next application startup.

histogram.name: IOS.MetricKit.ApplicationHangTime
histogram.summary: The durations of time in which the app is too busy to handle user interaction responsively. Logged when a MXMetricPayload is received (one per day).

histogram.name: IOS.MetricKit.ApplicationResumeTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to resume the app from the background. Logged when a MXMetricPayload is received (one per day).

histogram.name: IOS.MetricKit.AverageSuspendedMemory
histogram.summary: The average amount of memory in use by the app when it's suspended. Logged when a MXMetricPayload is received (one per day).

histogram.name: IOS.MetricKit.BackgroundExitData
histogram.summary: The reason for the application termination in background. Logged when a MXMetricPayload is received (one per day).

histogram.name: IOS.MetricKit.BackgroundTimePerDay
histogram.summary: The total time the app is in the background. Logged when a MXMetricPayload is received (one per day). Note: The date the data is reported is later than the day it account for.

histogram.name: IOS.MetricKit.ForegroundExitData
histogram.summary: The reason for the application termination in background. Logged when a MXMetricPayload is received (one per day).

histogram.name: IOS.MetricKit.ForegroundTimePerDay
histogram.summary: The total time the app is in the foreground. Logged when a MXMetricPayload is received (one per day). Note: The date the data is reported is later than the day it account for.

histogram.name: IOS.MetricKit.PeakMemoryUsage
histogram.summary: The largest amount of memory used by the app. Logged when a MXMetricPayload is received (one per day).

histogram.name: IOS.MetricKit.TimeToFirstDraw
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to launch the app. Logged when a MXMetricPayload is received (one per day).

histogram.name: IOS.MultiWindow.Configuration
histogram.summary: MultiWindow configration sampled once per minute.

histogram.name: IOS.MultiWindow.OpenInNewWindow
histogram.summary: The source of "Open in new Window" user requests. Recorded when a newly created window is added to a session.

histogram.name: IOS.NSString.stringByReplacingCharactersInRange.NilArgument
histogram.summary: NSString API: stringByReplacingCharactersInRange:withString: was invoked with a nil argument.

histogram.name: IOS.NTP.Impression
histogram.summary: The type of NTP impressions on iOS, split by type of suggestions shown (local vs remote vs remote_collapsed).

histogram.name: IOS.OpenIn.DownloadResult
histogram.summary: The result of the download operation done when the user taps "open in" button to open a file by a different application.

histogram.name: IOS.OpenIn.MimeType
histogram.summary: The MIME type of the previwed file when the "Open In" toolbar is presented.

histogram.name: IOS.PageLoadCount.Counts
histogram.summary: The number of navigation started events by navigation type.

histogram.name: IOS.PageLoadCount.LoadingStarted
histogram.summary: The "true" value of this boolean histogram counts the number of page loading started events. The "false" value will never be seen.

histogram.name: IOS.PageLoadedSnapshotResult
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of snapshotting when the page has been loaded.

histogram.name: IOS.PageLoadTiming.OmnibarToPageLoaded
histogram.summary: Measures the time from the end of user input in the omnibox to when the page is fully loaded. Only measures page loads initiated by user typing a URL or selecting a suggested entry from the URL bar.

histogram.name: IOS.Reauth.Password.Autofill
histogram.summary: Tracks the results and attempts of reauthentication when using password Autofill suggestions.

histogram.name: IOS.Reauth.Password.ManualFallback
histogram.summary: Tracks the results and attempts of reauthentication when using a password in Manual Fallback.

histogram.name: IOS.RepeatedExternalAppPromptResponse
histogram.summary: The user reaction to the prompt that appears when a website tries to open an external application repeatedly.

histogram.name: IOS.RestoreNavigationItemCount
histogram.summary: [iOS] The number of items Navigation Manager was requested to restore. 100 is logged when the number of navigation items is greater than 100. This is just a requested count and actual number of restored items can be smaller. Restoration is triggered in the following cases (the list is not exhaustive): app cold start, remote tab was open, cookie were cleared, recently closed tab was restored.

histogram.name: IOS.RestoreNavigationTime
histogram.summary: [iOS] Time spent on restoring committed Navigation Manager's items. Recorded once per restoration, as a cumulative time across all items. Restoration is triggered in the following cases (the list is not exhaustive): app cold start, remote tab was open, cookies were cleared, recently closed tab was restored. This metric will be used for monitoring session restoration performance which relies on system's WKWebView.

histogram.name: IOS.SafeBrowsing.RedirectedRequestResponseHostsMatch
histogram.summary: The URL in a navigation request should have the same host as the URL in the corresponding response, but this sometimes doesn't hold after a server redirect because of a WKWebView bug. This histogram counts the frequency of this invariant violation, and is logged each time that a main-frame navigation response is received after a server redirect. True means that the request and response URLs have the same host.

histogram.name: IOS.SearchExtension.Action
histogram.summary: The action selected by the user in the Search Extension.

histogram.name: IOS.SearchExtension.DisplayCount
histogram.summary: The number of times the Search Extension was displayed since last Chrome foregrounding. Reported when Chrome is put in foreground.

histogram.name: IOS.ShareExtension.ReceivedEntriesCount
histogram.summary: The number of items received simultaneously in Chrome from the IOS share extension.

histogram.name: IOS.ShareExtension.ReceivedEntry
histogram.summary: Type of the item received from the iOS share extension.

histogram.name: IOS.ShareExtension.ReceivedEntryDelay
histogram.summary: The delay in milliseconds between the item creation in the extension and its processing in Chrome.

histogram.name: IOS.ShareExtension.Source
histogram.summary: The source application that sent the external command to Chrome.

histogram.name: IOS.SharePageLatency
histogram.summary: The latency in milliseconds between the start of the Share Page operation and when the UI is ready to be presented.

histogram.name: IOS.SiriShortcuts.Count
histogram.summary: Counts the number of Chrome Siri Shortcuts that the user has created in the Siri Shortcuts app. This is recorded once during startup. The histogram caps at 20 shortcuts, which is an arbitrary but reasonable limit. Note that shortcuts that have multiple actions are not counted if at least one action isn't a Chrome-provided one. For example, a shortcut that opens URLs in Chrome and then opens URLs in another app won't be counted. As such, this metric undercounts the true number of Chrome shortcuts. This is a restriction of the native Shortcuts API.

histogram.name: IOS.Spotlight.Action
histogram.summary: The Spotlight Action pressed by the user.

histogram.name: IOS.Spotlight.Availability
histogram.summary: Tracks the availability of the Spotlight indexation on the device. It is logged once at each cold start. Note: Spotlight may be available on the device but disabled by the user.

histogram.name: IOS.Spotlight.BookmarksIndexingDuration
histogram.summary: Time spent in Spotlight initial indexation of bookmarks.

histogram.name: IOS.Spotlight.BookmarksInitialIndexSize
histogram.summary: Number of bookmarks indexed during initial indexation.

histogram.name: IOS.Spotlight.Origin
histogram.summary: This event is recorded each time a Chrome Spotlight entry is selected by the user. The enumeration indicates the nature of the Spotlight entry.

histogram.name: IOS.StoreKit.ITunesURLsHandlingResult
histogram.summary: The result of StoreKit handling for a specific iTunes URL. Not Handled will be logged when the LinksHandler didn't handle a specific URL on purpose (not supported), and Failure will be logged when a URL that should have been handled wasn't handled.

histogram.name: IOS.StoreKitLoadedSuccessfully
histogram.summary: Whether the StoreKit loaded the required iTunes product successfully or not.

histogram.name: IOS.TabSwitcher.PageChangeInteraction
histogram.summary: The UI interaction by which the user changed the visible page in the tab switcher.

histogram.name: IOS.Web.URLDidChangeToEmptyURL
histogram.summary: A boolean that is used to indicate that the URL property of the WKWebView has changed to a nil or empty URL. Recorded on the KVO of the URL of the WKWebView.

histogram.name: IOS.WidgetKit.Action
histogram.summary: Measures UI interactions in WidgetKit extension. Recorded after a user taps in a widget and Chrome is openned.

histogram.name: IOS.WidgetKit.{Status}
histogram.summary: Indicates the {Status} of an iOS 14 widget. Logged when the app goes to foreground. "Current" widgets are logged everytime widgets are detected, "Install" and "Uninstall" are logged only when changes are detected. It is important to consider the bias created towards users that foreground the app more often when doing analysis. This can be accounted by filtering per unique users when looking at the metric.

histogram.name: IOS.WKWebViewClobberedHistory
histogram.summary: Measures the number of main frame navigations in slim navigation manager that are affected by a WKWebView bug that corrupts back/forward history (http://crbug.com/887497). This is recorded during WKWebView's decidePolicyForNavigationAction callback. True means the bug is triggered. False means the bug is not triggered.

histogram.name: IOS.WKWebViewFinishBeforeCommit
histogram.summary: WKWebView should notify navigation commit before navigation finish, but exceptions have been observed. This histogram counts the frequency of this invariant violation at the time when a new navigation is finished. True means navigation finish callback happened before navigation commit.

histogram.name: IOS.WKWebViewLinkPreview
histogram.summary: Records the user actions related to the WKWebView 3D touch link preview API.
